intro: Angolluma fenestrata, commonly known as the windowleaf plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its striking, fenestrated (window-like) leaves that allow light to pass through, creating a distinctive visual effect. Native to the tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its stems are often woody and can grow攀援 or as shrubs, depending on the conditions. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
